f4n7wHM6Xy7y_FdO7A9qxA.text: Great crepes with a strange but good twist on flavors.The food... the portions are a good size.  We had one per person and we were full for hours.  I tried the spicy old dutch, my brother tried the lamb.  Both were pretty heavy.  The Old dutch comes like a pizza and a spicy oil based sauce.  Though it might get a little too spicy if you're not ready.  The lamb was good as well, but was HEAVY.  Plan on a food coma nap after one of these!The venue is a bit cramped up front, but it's a testament to their popularity.  I would definitely consider coming back here again.

GG_WAyQTb43W1zmoRu-DFQ.text: English breakfast with pancakes and scrambled eggs was good. Service is not outstanding but it's good enough. It's worth visiting if you're looking for a variety of pancakes to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast: pancake with scrambled eggs.

YS2xxwU6MayKszw7rz88LQ.text: The place is just the perfect spot if you're looking for a sugar rush. The classic Hot Dutch pancake (it is singular because the pancakes at this joint are enormous) is just delightful - sweet and savory and I sure am thankful that I don't live nearby. Otherwise, I'd be stuck here most of the time and maybe weigh a tad more. The drinks are great - lots of milkshakes to choose from and an assortment of fruit beers which are also quite interesting and out of the stereotype.

ew64mf5l84Nz-pqb_9zlgg.text: This rating is a very tough call for me ... between 3 stars and 4.First of all, what My Old Dutch serves is not really pancakes, but they are more like crepes. But they do it very well. They have a variety of sweet and savoury alternatives to choose from. On both the occasions that i have visited, it had been for dinner and so i had given the sweet stuff a miss. I have tried the chicken with rice, and the Moroccan lamb stew. Both were fabulous. However the rice that came with the chicken crepe was too dry, and frankly unnecessary. The portions are really big ... and they come in huge plates that cover half the table. It reminded me of the way Ethiopian injera is served. If you are really hungry, one would be good enough ... else, try to share with someone else.I have tried the milk shakes here. They are quite nice (and expensive, at £4 each). But they provide a tumbler full of shake, which will surely last you the entire meal.Even though the food is good, the service here is not up to the mark. The place is very popular and so frequently customers have to queue. But nobody comes to tell you how long the wait is likely to be. In fact, i didn't find anyone even acknowledging our existence until a table was free. They asked us whether we would like to share a table. We didn't mind. But they shouldn't have suggested that if it meant we had to get up every time access was needed to the other group using the table.The crepes generally cost about £9-£10 each, but they have a special Monday offer when they are priced at only £5. That makes my old dutch exceedingly cheap on the day. It wouldn't be my first choice for a dinner out on a weekend, but on a monday it will be right up there in the list of alternatives :)

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Chicken curry crepe with rice

lA-RC4UlafIrhaXSr8OGFw.text: Service is inattentive. Crepes (not pancakes) would be better if they were cooked throughout- they are too doughy.

pezjKWD1QPF953h50kp7kw.text: Visited for the first time over a weekend, when it was quiet enough to be seated straight away, and there were a few other empty tables. The service was efficient and friendly, but the pancake I had was pretty mediocre.I had the Amsterdammer pancake which is made with sauteed apples, smoked bacon and maple syrup. Unfortunately every component was a disappointment. The apples were bitter and chewy, the bacon was fatty and completely devoid of flavour (I'd question if it was really smoked), and the maple syrup was actually cheap generic pancake syrup, no different than you'd get with a Mc Donald's pancake. At £7.95 and nothing to be happy about at all, it felt like a con.The chocolate milkshake was considerably better, made with loads of ice cream and served with extras in the blender tin, but it wasn't enough to rescue their main dish, and supposed speciality, and I left disappointed.

ryruygkXtBWQVt1yJaFY0w.text: We were on holiday from the US and ate lunch here for the first time last week.The word "pancake" sounded interesting and I noticed lots of American accents around us.  I love American pancakes and missed them.   This restaurant seems to be more crepe like though than a traditional American breakfast pancake----maybe they were on the menu and I just missed them.  The food tasted good but I was really surprised how expensive it was.   We had two of the smaller "lite" pancakes and one dessert that we split, plus some water.  The total came to about 30 pounds.  That is about 47 US dollars.   Maybe I don't understand how expensive London restaurants can be but we had dinner the night before in a very nice London restaurant for less money.

pvjM0usyQtJPNdkZroeNag.text: These are huge! I used to come here every Monday when the Crepes were 5 Pounds each. For that price and for the size of the pancakes it was well worth it! Plus the wait was never that bad. I've had better crepes, but if you are a student or tourist on a budget I wouldn't skip this place. Savory or Sweet Crepes they are 5 pounds! Not sure if they still have the 5 Pound deal going on but it's worth calling in and checking.

kni22AYHvq5JWLc-3rxU4Q.text: I hope you like pancakes, because that is ALL they have.   Sweet, savory, they're all quite large and good (not great).  The pancakes were very thin (see crepe') and had smooth eggy flavor with crisp edges.  You can have them served with a variety of toppings from lamb stew, Hawaiian style (ham cheese and pineapple), or with fruit.   I had the traditional pancake with butter, lemon, and powdered sugar and I must say that is a great combination.  It was so good.  I was however a bit overwhelmed by the size as it was literally the size of a manhole cover (approx 18 inches across).   They do have salads, which I suspect are also served on pancakes as well.  Doesn't that defeat the purpose of having a salad?   Definitely worth the trip.  Bring stretchy pants.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. One tasty manhole cover

lVTcgDGxS4a1tKvyD9bSPw.text: All that needs to be said is that the pancakes were enormous, so understandably my friend Angharad struggled to get through her chilli con carne-filled pancake. I thoroughly enjoyed (and completely polished off) my Amsterdammer  a pancake with apple slices, bacon and maple syrup. There are rumours circulating that I also finished Angharad's pancake for her, but I will neither confirm nor deny this.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom

8heKhC9a6NC7oGO--pITXA.text: This is a nice little set up here! - Good space, looks cosy and the portions are dear! I was astonished at how huge the pancake actually was - i shouldn't complain really, its better to feel like a stuffed turkey than a starved animal (if that makes sense) ha ha; the supersize portion would be great for sharing, so its better for your pocket! They have a nice variety of savoury and sweets and it arrives super quick! Your bound to find something you like on the menu so give it a try!

GO0jtexKNWcc-JSi83rEqg.text: I can never resist pancakes, especially the Dutch kind as they are known for making them so wonderfully big! The decor is simple and plain, but the enormity and exciting of the pancakes certainly makes up for it.The menu consists of savoury and sweet pancakes (at an additional cost you can also choose to have extra toppings) traditional Dutch starters and a range of desserts. There is an eclectic choice of flavours to choose from the savoury pancake list such as chilli con carne, chicken curry, smoked duck and smoked salmon. In this case I prefer the simpler option of creamed spinach and cheese (with some added smoked bacon). For the sweet pancake option, again I usually go for the more toned down choices such as the one with sugar and lemon, or maple syrup and butter.As already stressed, the pancakes are large, and believe me you will easily be more than full after eating it. I suggest going halves with someone, maybe sharing a choice from both the savoury and sweet pancake option, therefore you get to enjoy both types.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom

XQSXS9BtAK4FCL6oIJ5_yA.text: i absolutely loved this place. Come here on mondays! ALL pancakes are only 5 pounds! I came here with 3 other friends and we all got different things. I ordered the banana nut pancake smothered in chocolate syrup and vanilla ice cream. I just wish they had more bananas in them. My other friend got the chicken curry and a chocolate banana milkshake. It tasted like Indian food on a pancake. My two other friends got the Old Dutch. This is pretty much what they are known for. It tasted like a thin crusted pizza. It was absolutely delicious. As a tourist, I highly recommend all new-towners to try out this joint. It will be the highlight of the three meals you consume for the day. I guarantee you. I definitely want to come here and try their waffles next time. It was off the charts.

yjtmOYIVgkNOHhiF_yOcFw.text: Had the avocado salad (after seeing the massive size of the pancakes, didn't feel capable of having one for lunch without a 2h digestive nap), which was good, but slightly pricey for the amount. The Kaasballen I ordered as a side were delish, perfect for sharing. Followed up with a massive plate of Poffertjes and ice cream, I felt super satiated and happy. Nevertheless, probably wouldn't pay the £18 for the experience again. Next time, going on Monday, when it's £5 per pancake!

kiweC_Kav4VDgNylCR09fw.text: A fondly remembered holiday in Amsterdam left me with a craving for properly done Dutch pancakes, so I eagerly sought My Old Dutch out on my return to London. The pancakes certainly don't disappoint. They are huge (you can barely fit 2 of them on a table, so you may have to be selfish and dine alone!), and the choice is toppings is vast  not good for someone as indecisive as me! If you're visiting for the first time, try the Amsterdammer (bacon, apple and maple syrup), or My Old Dutch (pretty much a bit of everything). I've not (as yet) had the appetite to follow my meal with a sweet pancake. My only gripe with My Old Dutch would be that the service is sometimes less than courteous. For example we were told quite sharply  in a nearly empty restaurant  that we couldn't move from our wobbly table to another.

SZXHMYYjyu5YzqKiFNZuZQ.text: Great place for lunch mid-week. Normally I have a rule that I don't eat anything bigger than my own face, but I make an exception for this place. The pancakes are about as big as a car wheel, and they struggle to fit them on the table. I'm not sure if this deal still is on offer, but go on Mondays for £5 pancakes - the duck (savoury) pancake is the BEST! I used to go every week and I enjoyed the pancakes so much that I started going back when it wasn't £5 a pancake - the normal price of ~ £9. While £9 is a lot for a pancake for lunch , they are good pancakes. The manager there - from memory a guy with grey hair, is really friendly and cheeky and a good laugh. Great customer service from him (a rarity of places in Central London) and most of the other staff.

U5Y_k2ZR3MwHoVp1gNR7Gg.text: I am not a big pancake fan. Anyway today we decided to go the "My Old Dutch". The food was fine and I liked it more than I thought before. I had pancakes with Chilli con Carne and one with nutella later.The service has room for improvement to say it politely. The waiter didn't even know the menu which made it hard to order. He spilled the drinks etc.It's a little bit pricey so. 12.5% Service charge is included which explains the poor service. The restaurant has step-free access.

dG_EkGSW5ZHYfgVBXMzo0A.text: After reading the excellent Miss Rachelle's guide I too was disappointed. This comes after enjoying previous pancakes from the now defunct Ealing branch of My Old Dutch. I sent this emall below 3 times over a week to info@myolddutch.com to get a 'we have received your email' acknowledgement. I still have not had a proper response as of today. Yes today is pancake day and am off to buy a pan now to make my own. Here's my email: I had a meal for two, dining in at your holborn branch. i ordered the seafood pancake, citing 'king prawns' as an ingredient when the disappointingly sparse topping of the pancake arrived it wasindeed tiny frozen prawns, these were not even small prawns, never mind being king prawns.a couple of prawns (upon near completing the pancake- as i was hungry)were actually still frozen in the middle!i was most disappointed with this breach of advertising descriptions of sales of goods act 1979 failure and the fact i had 'optionalservice' added. i could not complain as the service was fine, it was the ingredients, lack of topping (on the MOD savoury) and the cooking that was theproblem.i have a photo/scan of the receipt if neededthe meal was on 9th jan 2010 at 2.21pm. Sahira was our serverThe bill was £24.92 --- I'm off to Argos to go pancake pan shopping.

cGLP1ZNobnL88pp6wmx3yQ.text: While visiting London, some friends of ours told us about My Old Dutch, and said we should meet up there for lunch on my afternoon off.  Apparently Monday are £5 pancake days, so that worked out great.  My girlfriend and I shared a duck pancake, and we also had a berry pancake.  The food was delicious, and very reasonably priced for London.  Unfortunately the service left a little something to be desired... it's as if they were inconvenienced with us needing such things as silverware and more water.  Either way, still a fun place.

6OJ9DLKITrO8wVBdQtT5Qg.text: I went here to celebrate my first Pancake Day.I was impatient to see how they can eat crepes and Pancake in England. I have to say I was disappointing. I ordered an Old dutch without corn but I don't see the difference with or without. Besides, the crepe isn't very good. It was only to fill the belly but without pleasure.To finish by the good points, my collegue asked to take away the rest of her crepe and the waiter put it in a box quickly. Maybe I will be back to try the dessert. The crepe with nutella and banana seem so good.

J2PMA23Pg_g2cWkEVEVRQg.text: Went to My Old Dutch this morning for some poffertjes. I had the traditional (maple syrup and icing sugar) and hubby had strawberries and cream. Good portion size and decent value. I felt sorry for the new staff though,  terrible manager who had no idea how to train... she just kept yelling and embarrassing them...

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Strawberries and cream
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Traditional

61G5fvjWlKJs2fEYTxQDbQ.text: We went My Old Dutch to for a spontaneous bite to eat one Saturday afternoon. I really liked this place. The pancakes are not your conventional small and light things; they come out on these humongous plates the size of Saturn and are incredibly filling. I chose the Hot Dutch, which topped with salami, pepperoni, cheese and chilli was more like a delicious pizza than any pancake I have ever had. And it was awesome. As I write this, I am lusting for a round two. Highly recommended.

UO4YQFISHpXfJyU1vsnNbw.text: So, so good. Between a group of four of us, we had cheese and mushroom, Nutella and banana, bacon and maple syrup and apple and cinnamon. Not only was everything delicious, it only cost us £9 each! Absolute bargain.

2YdfvHfY4nCZR-HoNBp7bA.text: Go on Mondays for their 5£ any sweet or savory pancake!!! The coffee shake was delicious I also had the apple and cinnamon pancake it was so good and that's saying a lot for me because I am not a fan of apples. A great treat after hitting up the British museum!

8_xCmTPJUFy0InPfPD6vGQ.text: As a general rule, I try to squeeze bacon into my life wherever I can. Breakfasts, burgers, conversations, it's pretty much a staple of my day-to-day being. Which is why seeing the glorious pig straps as an option of pancake filling drew me to My Old Dutch. A quaint little place nestled in the bustling High Holborn, this famous pancake house has choices that would satisfy even the most adventurous of foodies. Fancy chocolate chip with chocolate sauce or warming apple cinnamon? Go to My Old Dutch. Have a hankering for chilli con carne, halal lamb stew or chicken curry in your pancake? My Old Dutch. Fancy an old wellington boot on a plate? No. Go away. There's something for everyone, whether you're on a diet and fancy a salad instead (though, why you're in a pancake house, I can't fathom...), or whether you're Gluten Free. Unless you go for a Lite Bite or surrender to the good old Doggy Bag walk of shame, I would suggest building up a large appetite, as these pancakes are huge. As much I had to battle my way through the thing (Kaysha doesn't waste food), I would definitely visit again, if not to try their all new Butterscotch range, then to sample as many of their fruit beers as socially acceptable in one sitting; because where else can you find cherry, mango, banana, peach, strawberry or passion fruit beer all under one roof? Anyone who can answer this question, I will love forever. Genuinely.

fkaAQO34dbA1BbUaOq0Stg.text: Ehhhh not exactly the greatest. I ordered a sweet pancake with peaches. The "peaches" were from the can! I understand this place is a chain but seriously you need to buy actual peaches. Far too much sugar and not so great service. The waitress also tried to trick me into paying the optional service fee. Will not be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom

SEnMom4Hje1-7Ndr2Vy2Dg.text: Quick summary;Kids love itAdults get huge portions(even the salads)Beer a bit priceyNeed better chairsDecent value for food

xZbnrL28w7DHmOsr1efoRA.text: I think the monday madness deall just did it for me. All pancakes are 5 squids and are not half bad either. On reading many many yelp reviews, a friend and I decided to share one savory and one sweet, and it was a good idea, by the time we got to sweet, we didn't even finish. But only the portion sizes were impressive. Flavours weren't too great. The smoked salmon and mushroom was really creamy, not sure if it worked that well though. The berry compote was a bit tart. (The whore!) Remember my story about the giant scone at Camelia's Tea House. This is his relative- the giant pancake. Also, try to go with less people? There's always a queue on mondays. so be prepared to wait!

HfiqLkVfYTtFuBL94XC0Ew.text: What better way to celebrate watching someone run 10km thatnwith pancakes? It's just like I participated...All that running works up an appetite so good thing these pancakes are HUGE. and generously filled with all kinds of goodies. The kinds of things you would never dream would be good in a pancake but kind of are. Some of the ingredients aren't the best and it seems a bit overpriced (except on Mondays, then it's a steal!), but it's good wholesome food.On this occasion we sampled 3 savoury pancakes between 4 to have room for pudding (because how can you not leave room for a sweet pancake!) - the smoked salmon was okay but overdid the cream sauce, the lamb stew works really nicely with the sauce but the lamb is a tad tough and the smoked duck was the star of the show here with hoi sin. Possibly because I love the flavour of duck & hoi sin, but it worked really well with the pancake base to mop up the remaining sauce.Puddings are a standard, I would recommend apple & cinnamon to give you a warming feeling that I expect with a pancake. Staff are a bit forgetful unfortunately, but I like the loyalty card of getting a pancake free after you buy 9 (in a group, you do that pretty quickly, we had 6 in one sitting!)

dgE3ug9xBzOaz2lQkuOCrA.text: The land of pancakes. Really huge pancakes with a variety of fillings. Meat, veggies, cheese...and even the sweet ones. Starters are more the size of main course. I ordered nachos for starters and trust me the bowl was huge and filled with nachos mixed with melted cheese and topped with sour cream, gaucamole, and hot salsa. Salsa would be mild if you are of indian origin. The collection of drinks are also amazing, from wheat beer to hot chocolate. A three course meal at. This place would be a feast and i totally feel that it is value for money. Quality food at affordable prices with friendly staff. Try the rich sundaes if you have some space left in your stomach after hogging the pancake. You wont regret.I ordered a bowl of nachos, hot chocolate and greek pancacke. It was quite a large meal so I couldn't finish it from there. But I don't like wasting food, so I asked them if they could pack it up for me and they did. And just had it now. It still tastes delicious. If you are starving then this place will fill you up.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Mint tea

6zgO8p3IzK9yOTl_HfY8rg.text: Came here for dessert and really enjoyed it. Had banana, nuts and Nutella pancake. Really enjoyed it but the portion was huge. The service was great and didn't have to wait around to be served or anything, very efficient service. Would come back if I was in the area.

_vMgEIumiRWRbeBJvWhBCg.text: I had quite a good experience at My Old Dutch, with the exception of one detail. So let's start with the good stuff, shall we? First, though the place was busy, it was easy to get a table and be seated. The food was delicious, and the style of 'pancake' was novel and kept well as take away. I also had soup, which warmed my heart and was a vital step in a particularly brutal hangover cure, and was pleased with it after having been caught in the rain. However, the timing of service was a little bit strange. I ordered soup while my friend ordered coffee. Her coffee came out alone, then her pancake and my soup, and finally my pancake came out after everything else was done (I asked for it just to be wrapped for take away). The timing of 'courses' was a little illogical then, as my friend started out before me and I would have ended well after. Other than that though, I found my savory pancake very tasty (as take away) and the service was good. I'd recommend My Old Dutch for a good Sunday brunch, any day of the week.

J3frtAbn181nBM-pCEzH9Q.text: I tried this place for the first time yesterday for Monday Maddness. It's a GODSEND for the student budget!The 7 of us were seated quickly (we went around 5:30pm, before the huge dinner rush) and it was rather difficult to decide what to get. A friend and I decided to split a savory one and a dessert one. We ordered the My Old Dutch and the Berries Compote with ice cream. Our food came out within 15-20 minutes and all of us started chowing down. Since our dessert pancake (if you're from the US, think crepe, not pancake) had ice cream, we had to eat that one first. The ice cream balanced out the tartness of the berries; it was a healthy dessert =) The My Old Dutch was delicious as well. By the time I reached 3/4, I was starting to find it difficult to eat any more, but it was so good I finished it all. The amount of food you get for £5 makes it worth it. There are so many different combinations; I'd really like to go back again next week to try a different pancake.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. compote of berries
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. chili con carne
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. ratatouille

fXJ20ylWziOKHc9aJhrv8Q.text: I had the chicken curry pancake which was ok, it was as though I'd made a pancake at home and poured microwave curry inside. None of the staff asked us even once how the meal was and when I was looking for the toilet I got the distinct feeling the owner believed I was trying to do a runner. My girlfriend had the Nutella one which she described as "ok". If I was asked if I'd recommend this place to a friend I would have to say no, mind you it is pretty cheap so I guess you get what you pay for. It wasn't terrible but it wasn't especially great. Just a bog standard cheap restaurant with ok staff, ok food, ok everything!

Ki1PEcpOvmk6dwUNLTJgvQ.text: Visited with a milkshake aficionado who was pretty nonplussed by the Oreo shake. The Nutella shake was tasty, but both were a little small for the price and would have benefitted from another scoop or two of ice cream.

U6IHOghaTH2uILOjFLhFdg.text: Fantastic panckes!They are slightly thicker than crepes and come either savoury or sweet. I went for a Greek pancake which had halloumi cooked into the pancake batter. Was delicious!The food and the price are great but the chairs are very uncomfortable which became more of an issue when we had to wait a long time for our food to come.I would say worth the wait though! Never had pancakes like this before.

NUQL9QJlUmJJcm5NfvYagg.text: Being from Amuurca, I can say I know a thing or two about a good pancake. But friends, never have I had the pleasure of knowing this Dutch pancake. Went with the ladies for our weekly breakfast, on the suggestion of another friend. We happened to get there just as they were opening, so it was perfect for us. Service wise, it has been the best I have gotten in London, but I can only imagine that when you are the only customers in the whole restaurant (and I was with my pretty friends) they can't miss you on the attention scale. Unlike all our other brekkies, I didn't visit the website before hand to figure out what I wanted which was a fail as I went back and forth between sweet and savoury with 2 waiter visits. *embarrassing Ended up ordering the Greek pancake as I was in need of feta. It was HUUUUUUUUUGE. I was sadly not warned about this, and had no time to do my stomach expanding breathing before hand. It was quite tasty and I must go again for the sweet. I say if you haven't done it, do it. It was good food for a great price.

CyUA5emHnqNA4VNFTu5jBg.text: Whyyyy?! I am an American who loves a good breakfast. I love pancakes of all widths and sizes and varying degrees of fluffiness. I like brunches and milkshakes and I keep searching for a cheap, tasty breakfast in London now that I've moved to the UK. I guess I've learned that cafes are the only way to go.This place is cheap...ish. £5 all-you-can-eat pancakes on Monday. I got the butter and maple syrup so I could eat multiple thin, crepe-like pancakes. I was ready. I got served a gelatinous pancake with two pats of margarine and some Log Cabin "syrup". It was vaguely charred and I just couldn't eat more than a third. Service was mediocre. I've waited tables so I think I have a pretty realistic concept of what to expect. Finished the meal, plates were cleared, and we waited... and waited... and waited for the bill. I'd be willing to try it again when it's busy, but won't be expecting a thing. Points for David Bowie being plastered all over the front windows.

foN5ETts-3crKc58-uhV-A.text: I came here with three friends at 12:30 on a Sunday afternoon for brunch without reserving a table, and had no problems being seated right away.  The restaurant is really cute with all wooden furniture, which makes it seem really quaint.There are plenty of choices of sweet and salty pancakes.  Me being American-ized to me it looked like a giant crepe. I went for the Nutella pancake and was very satisfied.  The strawberry shake left something to be desired on the other hand.  A friend of mine had a smoothie, which was much tastier.  I would suggest changing locations for coffee.  Seeing pancakes being served at other tables, the fruit salad pancakes were quite substantial, a couple was splitting one.  The service was great, and we had an excellent bruch.  I spent £12 for a pancake and a smoothie which I find to be of great value for London!

Kc0L1WgWVLeO1beNdlcJjw.text: The pancakes and crepes were reasonably fluffy and topping selection was nice. However, the savory crepe was served cold and the sweet pancakes were only a little warm. The butter could hardly melt on them!

liYB8WZ7AagEa0AwwZB1uA.text: Best pancakes ever. Go on Mondays because they have their Monday Madness deal where sweet and some savory pancakes are only 5 pounds. The pancakes are huge and if you think you can eat more than one, lol good luck buddy.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. banana and nuts and chocolate sauce

fuua3s-Gf8weUYUfGDKeWg.text: Food will be amazing if they had what we wanted, but it was all over. They also don't take American Express and some of the waitresses are rude. Thankfully the guy that served us after was nice!

xImQRv2lFAunO9kiyEvHxQ.text: I once played this facebook game called restaurant city. You start with a small room, you buy stoves, tables, chairs, and hire chefs and waiters. With the right ratio, you begin to get customers giving you money, so you can expand the space and hire more people. If you expand the space and put in too many tables and chairs, but not enough servers or cooks, the people will come in, sit down, grumble about the wait time, and leave, and eventually no one comes to your restaurant.Our experience with the Old Dutch Pancake House was a bit like that. We walked in with no one in the restaurant, to a whole restaurant full of people and no one had food, for a long time. And then eventually, the food started to come out, and ours was not there (the best part is probably that all we ordered was waffles and ice cream). After some complaints, the food eventually came, and the manager apologized several times and comped us the meal.The waffles were alright. Hard to go wrong with those. I watched the other people eat their giant pancakes and wished i had ordered these.Would I come back? Yes. Hopefully the owner/top management will play some restaurant city and figure out how it works  so that the service will be faster.Oh and the ambiance is quite adorable. I am really looking forward to coming back.

D9gjiQ-oMZwfBrQuppx3rA.text: Pancakes pancakes galore ;)A wide variety of sweet pancakes and savoury pancakes The sweet pancakes are a better choice The best is the chocolate nutella pancake  Average price is £8-12

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom

zRrj4RvAlyfZSDBY00tK5Q.text: Great place if you're in Holborn and want pancakes. The location is great - close to Holborn station and not a very far walk from Oxford Street or the Bloomsbury campuses (if you're a student like me). I've come here a couple times to try different flavours because they have such a huge menu! If you are looking for American style fluffy pancakes then get the Butterscotch ones. They come in five regular sized stacked pancakes, topped with powered sugar and whatever topping you chose. The chocolate chip pancakes I ordered were super sweet and very filling! The other pancakes are more similar to a crepe, thin and easily folded. They are seriously gigantic and you need to be very hungry to finish the whole thing! But a bonus to these is the lovely dutch painted plate they serve it on :) Service was fine, nothing spectacular but not too bad. The pancakes are definitely the main reason I come here, so many options and delicious every time!

Kdgt8skf-6aoHkY7KncKPA.text: It's flour and sugar and Nutella... How do you go wrong? Portions are huge and reasonably priced.

BsqWEyaonkmvFyvVL8BDdA.text: interesting because the ice cream on top of the Nutella pancake didn't taste like ice cream. it was an off white color and tasted a bit like icy cheese. The waitress said she was unsure of whether it was actually "ice cream" or not which seemed a bit strange - but everything else was okay. tap water tasted a bit salty.

v5K2KeMcI8BeZKBKnJ0klg.text: I absolutely love the pancakes a this place!!! They weren't what I initially expected (I thought they would be american style pancakes) but wow they were awesome. They're huge and you feel like you'll never finish but then its delicious so you just push yourself finish it all :) I had a taste of their savoury pancake too, and it was really nice though it's not something I would normally eat because I'm used to sweet pancakes. The shakes are also terrific like the vanilla one. Very simple and not too sweet.I highly recommend this space for a fairly inexpensive breakfast. Oh and students get 10% off so bring ID cards!

wCe5wWN-wUozhfFiNnltDg.text: Coming here on Monday is worth it but the wait is quite long. Pancakes are very filling.

Is the spot!The pancakes ( or crepes ) are indeed, flavoursome.I opted for the smoked salmon with mushrooms.Please take note that the sizes are crazy! The plate size is unreal! ( plate size big enough for t-rex). This is the very reason why it's worth the money.The venue itself, gives a vibe of an oldschool feel. CzwPs96l4_nTEW8LxAMl5w.text: This place was HORRIBLE and knows nothing about customer service! I went there on my own while visiting London in February. I was seated downstairs and it took a little bit for my waiter to come. I decided to build my own so I asked for pear, bananas, nuts and caramel. My order came out covered in powder sugar and after taking a picture I started eating it. Being delirious after a red eye flight and traversing around england I kind of zoned out while eating until I realized the pancake crepe was tasting weird. It had a VERY eggy taste to it and as I looked at it closer it was very yellow. The bananas were clearly not ripe when they were cut as they tasted like plantains instead. The pears were HARD and the caramel sauce tasted more like dulce de leche. As I looked around at the tables next to me I noticed that everyone else had a thin off- white pancake while mine was a egg yolk yellow pancake the consistency of a spongy american pancake. When you flipped over the banana the batter hadnt cooked properly anthehere was also runny batter inbetween the pears being covered by the powdered sugar. Disgusted and feeling slightly nauseous I called over a waitress and showed her what I had in front of me and her response was " You should have told me before you started eating it." I told her I didnt realize before since it was presented all nicely. She said she would talk to the manager after I insisted that something had to be done. After 10 minutes she comes back and says "sorry theres nothing we can do." They very clearly gave me food that was undercooked and was noticably NOT the kind of pancakes they serve there and yet still had the gall to serve it to me AND insist I had to pay! Horrible customer service, horrible "pancake" which is realistically more of a crepe. They should have inspections and go out of business. I would never recommend a place of business that operates the way they do. Apparently its all about the money for the owner. Disgusting.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. An UNCOOKED EGGY "pancake" underneath all that powdered sugar. OWNER refused to take reponsibility for this disaster and wanted me to pay

vIZ64IBWSSRToLdIIqvR0A.text: The pancakes were ok when I put them in my mouth I felt a smooth and supple texture of the pancakes slide across my moist lips and not the ones your thinking of. The Nutella got everywhere and I cleaned up my fanny

GhKZpIWsfvmbSIMPmxiorw.text: I have been bringing my students to my Old Dutch....since 1986 and have found it consistently good. It is a unique, inexpensive, casual restaurant that serves what Americans would call crepes. Just go with a friend so you can order one savory and one sweet and split them. They are huge so you will not walk away hungry. The service is often slow, especially if they are crowded, but the restaurant is convenient to get to as it is right across the street from the Holborn tube station and walking distance from Sir John Soanes and The British Museum. This facility  can accommodate large groups in the basement if you call ahead. On Mondays most of the pancakes are only 5 pounds and If you sit up near the front window, you can watch the world go by as you enjoy your unique and delicious meal.

EuLskFatFN8ZA5DwXN_izQ.text: Simply delish. Crepes are one of the best i had.  Ice Cream is quality. We couldn't finish.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Huge

BwPKGRMsZYmsgv-hpLZaDQ.text: Delicious huge crepes that are shareable for the price of one. I'm in love with Dutch styled crepes! Honestly get it with ice cream and it'll just melt in your mouth!

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Yum
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. They taste just like crepes

qGEVDXrb-xZv5bYPSVbL3w.text: SO good.This place is definitely a novelty, instagram-worthy, unique place to eat while in London. I went with a friend on a Thursday afternoon, and they were not crowded at all. We were seated immediately, and the staff was always very friendly and attentive.My friend got some form of butterscotch pancakes - the name is escaping me - and I got spicy chicken pancakes. When they came out, it was so surprising because my friend's was a stack of maybe 4 small pancakes, and mine was a humongous thin crepe. They were so different! Nevertheless my friend's sweet pancake and my savory pancake were both very delicious, and we thoroughly enjoyed them. We also both got milkshakes, which were thick, sweet, rich, and everything that makes life wonderful. I can't wait until I get to come here again!

bNSThgMl3i07d1DhXTWxig.text: Really nice restaurant!We went for a quick dinner and the selection of sweet and savory pancakes is excellent. We opted for a classic nutella pancake and a delicious maple, apple and bacon one ("Amsterdammer" on the menu, I totally recommend it!)The plates are ridiculously huge, although the dough it's thinner than an average american pancake, and it's more like a crepe. Well, thank god: I would've never finished such a giant plate, if it were thicker!The price is good too for London: we spent around 22 pounds for two pancakes, water and tea.I highly recommend it!

mUrrdbFLcPEIuksIUgBzGw.text: Top tip - go on a Monday - you can get their selection of normally quit pricey sweet and savoury pancakes for only a fiver. Can get busy and they don't seat until all your party has arrived but there is plenty of room - even downstairs and service is fast and efficient. The pancakes themselves are nice and big (see pics) with a world buffet type selection of buffet options - filling and taste nice. They also do choco bar milkshakes so you can have a fully non grown-up meal.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Salmon and mushroom sauce pancake
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Sweet pancake

_B0itX5F5mPNjWf1uquLlg.text: Met a friend here for an early lunch, looking to make the most of being in London and trying something a bit different. I was expecting something similar to IHOP in the states, with huge stacks of pancakes covered in maple syrup and garnished with bacon. But it was much more interesting than that, they had a large range of savoury pancakes as well as the sweet and the butterscotch. The smoked salmon with mushroom and dill sauce that I chose was lovely and an overly generous portion size for the prize.The decor was nice enough, nothing to complain or rave about and everything was clean. All of the staff were very friendly and attentive as well.I'll definitely be back again (the queue for a table suggests this is a common feeling)

5z3FTAhOYiRGGtZQY4N8GA.text: Kitsch and tacky decor - check out the plastic grass on the wall!  My Old Dutch Pancake House doesn't tke itself seriously and nor should you.  It's fun, cheap and cheerful.  If you're expecting anything more you're in the wrong place.I had the seafood pancake, resembled a swirly pizza when it arrived in front of me. All washed down with nice bottle of Hoegaarden.Pleasant service.

SU1lLqAT0YiGuagoWuUdNg.text: Meh. Just meh. Be warned the "butterscotch pancakes" are American-style pancakes, not butterscotch in any meaningful way (the waitress told me there is butterscotch in the batter, but there wasn't enough for me to taste it). My friend's gluten-free pancake was burnt. Gluten-free is hard to get right so I'd say this is average, and I'm glad they have the option. The "butterscotch" pancake was very dry. I saw some amazing creations and do intend to go back, but my first experience was a let down and quite poor. Looking on other people's tables, I would suggest sticking to the sweet pancakes as they seem to be what they do best.

ul2FfGebHvGF0x0mzTM52w.text: As great lovers of pancakes, my husband and I simply had to try My Old Dutch. I was rather impressed with the selection and actually found it quite difficult to make my choice. The only thing that let the place down was the service, which was rather clumsy and slow. Several people around us were getting agitated at the lack of urgency and incorrect toppings on their pancakes.All in all, I would recommend My Old Dutch, but not if you are in a rush!

GI_xJbvd0WuURhIxW7V_3w.text: I quite torn in how to review this so I'll break it down.Atmosphere Good: reminds me of a Canadian breakfast place called Coras... Its quite a pseudo dutch feel.Bad: it's a bit cheap, it is what it is, it's dimly lit inside.Middle: get a window seat for lighting. FoodGood: depends what you order and whose working. The first item... The I believer amsterdammer was nice. My friend had it. It was warm through, cooked, moist. Nothing amazing except the size. See.photos Bad: my gluten free was a disaster. It was under cooked. I was later informed they'd cooked.it milk free too... Whixh is good but I didn't ask for that. Also the chicken was over cookedGood... The manager was good, he asked me what was wrong, I as politely as I could after eating only half informed him of my dry under cooked pancake...  I felt bad... He took it on-board, and then said we could have a  free pancake..so we had desert pancake to order (which did have milk in the gluten free mix) and it was really really really good.. But you can't go wrong with chocolate banana strawberry and cream.. SummaryBrilliant manager.... But had that vibe of the staff might be a little underpaid and don't care... Or the staff don't really talk to each other. I like.turning around and seeing the staff have a sneaky chat with a smile. Noone was happy.  The food when loved was good... But inconsistent.The manager saved it really I was close to 1star but u do love good service and ability to change things about. That second pancake was good.

GE0mMzZt24Zusft21wHj9A.text: My old Dutch have some really nice pancakes and their coffee milkshake is definitely worth checking out. I went for the butterscotch pancakes with fruits and was just enough. Service was good and will look to come back again.

X77Y0FjAZeiSggTQkWp68Q.text: I'm in love with pancakes so this place was amazing for me! This place has pancakes of all kinds, from savory to sweet. The Monday deal was sweet- £5 for almost all of the pancakes on the menu. I ordered the berry pancake and added bananas to it. When the pancake came, I was in shock to see how huge it was- it was almost the size of a small puppy or something :x not that I didn't enjoy the huge portions or anything.... The sweets lover in me still ate the whole thing LOL. The pancake was delicious, it had blackberries, strawberries and raspberries in it. It filled me up, but I only wish I had enough room in my stomach to try a savory crepe. The restaurant itself is very big, staff was friendly and service was quick. Definitely one of the most unique and satisfying dessert places I've been to in London!

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom

a1hcpNj5LmXheRALNGWx-w.text: I've probably been to Old Dutch enough times to know their menu by heart. First up, on Mondays are £5 for all pancakes. When I say pancakes, these are gigantic crepes with toppings (Dutch style). When I say enormous, I mean enormous. Too many friends have scoffed when I tell them how big a pancake is and been defeated. So work up an appetite before you go.You can get either savoury or sweet pancakes and there are a good list of choices for both. The salmon one is my personal favourite - smoked salmon, creamy sauce and mushrooms. The sauce is rich and delicious and they don't scrimp on the salmon you get. Probably the most filling pancake. The seafood one is a close second. It's closer to a seafood pizza on a crepe with a tomato base and topped with cheese and prawns, anchovies and capers. Might sound a bit weird but it works, trust me! As for sweet pancakes, the berries one is OK. The berries can be very acidic sometimes which can make it quite unpleasant. They don't taste very fresh either. The banana and chocolate one is a better choice IMO. You are given the chocolate sauce to drizzle yourself and these are classic flavours which you can't really go wrong with. Atmosphere wise, it's a cute restaurant with a very strong Dutch theme - think windmill plates and tulip motifs. It does get very busy on Mondays thanks to the offer so expect a queue in the evenings.

MdD5m3_EkJl-_rkaut_Eng.text: Decided to go here for pancake day last year so knew it would be crazy busy and they don't take booking on that day because of it. Tbh we didn't queue for that long! And were seated and served quickly but not rushedInside the decor is a bit crap but bright and cleanMenu is massive with some different filling! Bf and I shared a savoury crepe - Mexican one with chilli, guac and sour cream and nachos on the side. It was actually really tasty and went so I would be brave enough to go for something else savoury next time as wellwe both got American pancakes with different sugary sweet toppings for pudding, chocolate fruit etc and they were tasty but not amazingThe price is really the draw back along with a pancake is a pancake! Nothing special but fun and good for the occasionWon't go any other time of the yearWould like to go back another shrove Tuesday and sample some more of their savoury combos however at £10 a pancake it is a bit much! Fun and would recommend!

1l7pXX5axCdaKY1D8n97xA.text: Horrible food and service! First off let me start off by saying this restaurant has no idea of the meaning customer service. We weren't given any utensils and some of our milkshakes were missing, and when we asked for it( pleasantly I may add) the waitress was annoyed as if we were causing her trouble TO DO HER JOB! Honestly it has to be the worst restaurant I been while I was in London. The owner definitely needs an upgrade on his workers.

7sjWE2MHcVT6XHtuGmE49Q.text: My Old Dutch is such good value for money! The idea of savoury pancakes was introduced to me a few years ago and this place does not disappoint.It is located very close to Holborn station and inside jt boasts enough tables to cater for the lunchtime rush and the after work crowd.  Furthermore they have a great deal on Mondays with pancakes mostly at a fiver a go.  As well as savoury for the sweet tooth folk out there do not fear, My Old Dutch have not forgotten about you, boasting a huge selection from Nutella pancakes to classic with whipped cream and fruit it is amazing.  They have good milkshakes however they are not any different to milkshakes available at most similar establishments.I had a duck pancake with a Nutella milkshake.  Both arrived very quickly and came in under £15.  I thought it was well worth the money and definitely filling.  My friends had various pancakes differing in size and toppings, my favourite was a fellow diner who had obviously done his research and gone for a sweet option.  The great thing as it is cheap, good location you can always go back for more and try all the items off their extensive menu, especially if you go on Monday Madness!

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Gorgeous pancake
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Nutella milkshake
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Duck pancake

WUCMspbw9ShMfpuaMRtkvw.text: Had a Dutch Pancake with lemon and sugar and some coffee. Have to say, it was the best coffee I've had so far in my life. And I'm talking straight black coffee, so smooth and strong. The pancake was delicious too! Definitely recommend, and it was well priced as well. My server was always on top of it and very nice. Great service and food! How could you get any better?

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Dutch pancake with lemon and sugar. And coffee!

TxoWgqgjwaptZbONuYMnDQ.text: I made an unplanned stop at my old Dutch to pick up a takeaway pancake for lunch as the chicken shop restaurant opposite at the Hoxton hotel was closed from Christmas until the new year.  The place was busy, it happened to be a Monday so most people were having a cheap lunch where a selection of pancakes are £5 both dine in and for takeaway.I opted for the 'my old Dutch' pancake consisting of ham, cheese, pepper and some other unmemorable fillings.  The pancake was stodgy, bland and rather burnt.  For takeaway no sauces were provided, only a sachet of salt to add a bit of taste.  Needless to say I shall not be returning to my old Dutch, the pancake was a complete disappointment I would rather grab a sandwich for lunch than another pancake from this place and that is coming from one who dislikes eating dull sandwiches for lunch!!

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. The my old Dutch takeaway pancake - not worth more anymore than the 5 Monday madness

CUZ9HicLYnvZlKdHZhXvAg.text: I was invited to My Old Dutch by a friend for his birthday meal, there were 20 of us and they were able to accommodate us with a large table downstairs. The service was quick and the range of toppings meant there was something for everyone. Plus the pricing is very cheap.I had the eggs florentine pancake. It was quite nice, fresh spinach and red onion. Plus 2 runny eggs. The portions are huge!! And I barely ate half of it, as you can see from my picture. I don't think it helped that I had a gluten free pancake which seemed much thicker than my friends. Great that they do gluten free though.I was really put off by the toilets in this restaurant. They smelt bad, weren't clean and had no working hand dryers. Hopefully the other restaurants in this chain are better maintained as I would like to go back and try  some sweet pancakes!

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. The remains of my eggs florentine pancake

Y8hZKDw--Dbk_Sx933sBEA.text: The portions are big. No, huge. Not expensive for the portions. The interior is very cute. The service is GREAT with great smiles and attentive service. The pancakes aren't too delicious (we got a savory and sweet pair) but good for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. We demolished half of each.

CKXwCA6n05UlDsHg4968Jw.text: My Old Dutch is a guilty pleasure of mine every time I'm back in London.Essentially it's all savoury or sweet giant pancakes (if you're American this means giant crepes). It's like Shrove Tuesday but ginormouser. So you've got that it's massive pancakes? Now just add deliciousness like bacon, smoked salmon, or even motto on lamb. I personally like cinnamon apple with bacon and maple syrup. Wash down with coffee and OJ.PS this is a small chain with two other London locations.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Moroccan Lamb pancake!

EFvsYKiXOBruFoNmy3jGgw.text: Simply my favourite restaurant, My Old Dutch delivers from every angle. Ever since I first tried this restaurant almost 10 years ago (at which point it was already a winning formula), I have seen this restaurant evolve over the years to even greater heights. The menu has expanded to offer more recommended recipes and sides, they allow you to custom order the toppings for your pancake, they continue to offer good discounts such as the Monday Madness (£5 per pancake), the variety of drinks (including fruit beers and milkshakes) are also fantastic and they can now cook gluten-free pancakes! Both the savoury and sweet pancakes are a delight and in good-sized portions, the atmosphere has always been good with cheerful service, homely Dutch decoration and well spaced out tables and ceilings so that it feels humble, open and welcoming. The combination of Belgian fruit beers or silky-smooth milkshakes together with the uniformly large pancakes are perfect for anyone with an appetite and particularly anyone with a sweet tooth. P.S. I have also used the Kensington branch which provides the same good all-round quality standards.P.P.S take away is nicely packaged and just as delicious

7_a55SgksmIiB1L_BIUluQ.text: I was here last time I was in London and had one of the savory pancakes for lunch, so I knew it was good. Came back this time for dessert about 8 pm on a Saturday night. Friendly service, and the dessert pancakes were outrageous. There were 5 of us in our group and only one person was able to finish his plate. Highly recommend this place.

_PDlJHzNiOkDjZSNv-OrjA.text: HUGE HUGE HUGE portions, but a little slim on the toppings for certain pancakes. I went with some friends and we ordered 2 salad and 2 pancakes. the 2 salads were fantastic (greek, and spinach and avocado). The fiorentina (egg and spinach) was very nicely balanced, but my italian was rather more just cheese and not much else. Still, it was tasty. Could have done with a few more slices of tomato or olives.We couldn't finish all the food, and was very promptly offered to take the leftovers away. Fantastic service.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. cheese laden pancake.

XctIORQFFSlnM-eHEmHZNg.text: It was ok. The service is pretty good but not fantastic, and as someone who prefers fluffy pancakes, I didn't love the food. If you're into crepes, a wide selection and huge portions you will love this place. I went on a Monday when most of their pancakes are £5 so it was well worth it. I'm glad I tried it, but I'm still searching for a favorite pancake house.

O35mdi9zboyC-WxsxH64Mw.text: Wondering how the pancakes look here? Imagine one of those throw-ups on the side of the street with fruit and Nutella in it, only you don't smell and taste that way. If you're happened to be here already, Nutella will be a safe bet! Remember that, you will see these pancakes again on the side of the street after you leave the restaurant.
