clSmEvGACmiWnRZMXlKgpw.text: Great pancakes, but a very noisy environment. The pancakes are huge but delicious. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend and come back to this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom

rSS2t6HeG_cixR8Esv66Tw.text: This was amazing! Several friends told us to not miss it and they did not disappoint. We had the "My English" pancake and Wow! So tasty! We will definitely be back... today for the sweet pancakes!

c4-DXiSAerXAr0zUW-LXiA.text: High five to My Old Dutch for offering vegan options including vegan pancakes, vegan cheese, and vegan ice cream (but why no vegan butter for the pancakes?).I would recommend that they reconsider their recipe for the vegan pancakes. They were so bad (thick, flavorless, and dry) that I couldn't eat more than three bites. I only ate the fruit I ordered that was on top of the pancakes. I found it interesting that they didn't ask if anything was wrong with the pancakes after they saw I didn't really touch them, but maybe they don't care that they're making gross pancakes (I actually cannot believe people eat these). My dining partner ordered the non-vegan pancake and, while they didn't think their pancake was as bad as mine, they were underwhelmed by their order too. Can't say I'd recommend this place.

OnheHIm1L5x2bCBX8tDbsw.text: Location, very easy to find. A short walk from the famous Tottenham Court Road and Holborn underground station.The restaurant/ Pancake bar/ Dessert Parlour is a nice spot. Very colourful in decor and personalities.On two of the three visits to this place I've received impeccable service. Friendly, hospital and responsive! The pancakes, both sweet and savoury are as colourful, tasty and if you want a sweet 'damn' you're in for a treat!I believe I spoke to the manager to kindly share the most recent experience with the young waiter who just seemed like he didn't want to work(if you're reading this, don't worry we all have bad days). The service from him was extremely poor but this was a rare occasion and the management apologised profusely so I will give this place another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Oops

BVehfcwkThptXUOnAUNvgw.text: On our way to the British Museum, Bryan and I come across My Old Dutch, we were drawn in by the Kinder signs and stayed because of the menu!We needed some delicious food to start our day, we ended up sharing The Kinder Chocolate Factory, which is butterscotch pancakes topped with Kinder everything as well as two scoops of chocolate ice cream. I felt like a kid in a candy store, we also added a side of scrambled eggs and bacon to make it a complete breakfast. The portion size is insane, this definitely fed both of us and we were glad that we would be walking around the museum to burn off those extra calories. The pancakes were cooked perfectly and sweetened just enough, with the kinder pieces you don't need syrup. There are other options other than the sweet pancakes, they also do savory pancakes as well and when I saw someones order my jaw dropped. I don't think there's a bad thing on this menu, price point it was so affordable. Service was great, the manager came by to check on us a couple of times and our server was really sweet. Definitely stop by My Old Dutch to satiate your sweet tooth!

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. So delicious I wish they sold this in the states!

JY3tmuwRLNKEEUJhuwQ0AQ.text: We had been walking past this place a few times and finally decided i would go in. I love pancakes so i thought i would love this place. However I was bitterly disappointed. We walked and we were given a table straight away. So we were quite please to start with. Then as soon as we sat down, my hands touched the table and I immediately questioned the cleanliness of the place due to the stickiness my fingers were facing. Not even a second later I realised that the whole place stank: a mix of chemical cleaning (i hope) products and sweat. When you go to a pancake place, you do expect smells from the kitchen, not dirty sweat! At that point I was ready to leave but my partner was really starving so we ordered some savoury pancakes. Once they arrived, the disappointment continued; very large plate with a large undercooked pancake with little fillings. I will not go back I'm afraid, it was simply not an enjoyable experience.

JENN-XnKqm31lXKZI6Heaw.text: Not as good as it looks. But it's a fun place to go if you have kids. Me, personally, didn't like it. But there is nothing really wrong or good. Very average.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom

yNOG4AKZlSDCDn8lTxqb_g.text: Seriously a fun place, with a really colorful interior and a great soundtrack rocking. On Mondays, many sweet and savory pancake options are close to half price, at £5.65 each! So we ordered two different ones, and they were each the size of a pizza. Huuuuuuge!!We got the My Old Dutch savory, with bacon, chicken, corn, and cheese, as well as the "Some like it hot" savory with spicy chilies, hot chicken, and cheese, and they were both great. The hot one was not really hot, but they brought a spicy chili oil that added a little heat. With a side salad and some beers, we had a delicious meal. Too much food! We couldn't do a dessert, but we saw a few that looked amazing. Worth a visit, especially on Mondays!

Txlt-SgAgl5oiBRpabdrlQ.text: When you really fancy pancakes, this is your place! I brought my mum here before we went to a West End show. We decided to share a savory pancake and then a sweet one. We went for the 'my old dutch' which is packed with bacon, chicken, ham, peppers and mushrooms. I did enjoy it but thought it was rather overpowered by the cheese, you couldn't really identify the different flavors, just the cheese! Dispute that I did still enjoy the pancake. We then opted for the Nutella pancake and added banana. I enjoyed it, but would have liked the pancake to be slightly thicker and a bit more banana. I would guess there wasn't even a full banana on the pancake, and the Nutella came in a small cup that you must pour on yourself. This could be deemed as a good thing or bad thing, but I just found it hard to evenly distribute the chocolate on the pancake! Service was quick and friendly, I will definitely return and next time I want to try the butterscotch pancakes which are thicker and better for a dessert. They gave me a loyalty card, which just means I will keep going back until I get the free one!

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. My Old Dutch - very cheesy!!
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Interior

LVg8v16ChQaSeXzAyhOfjw.text: Ok, let's talk about this for a second, this place is delicious!!!My only problem is calling what I ate pancakes, because they were blintzes or crepes, but not pancakes.Nonetheless, it was so good!We ordered the salmon from the savory section and the fruit salad with Nutella from  the sweet section. And we requested for the gluten free option so I can share with my GF husband. It was delicious!The waitress we had initially was a little slow but later we had a switch to a lovely waitress. The only mishap was when we asked for lemonade and got Sprite and they told us that this is the only lemonade they have..Cannot wait to be back and order a different flavor!!

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Salmon with mushroom sauce- amazing!
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Fruit salad with Nutella- delicious!

c5xaOnt6dyBSoVqOFxV1xQ.text: Good place for pancakes! I had a savory with shrimp, feta and rocket but saved some of the pancake itself to douse in syrup as my dessert. Two floors but the street level floor has more windows and thus natural lighting. Seems like a London institution so worth checking out if on vacation.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Savory pancake with shrimp and feta and rocket
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Savory pancake with shrimp and feta and rocket

8KoYBn6UAEHZrjGPn7xz4g.text: After walking past this place daily, I decided to check it out my last week in the area because its fun decor always attracted me. The service was quick and nice. The pancake was on the greasy side, but very filling. There's a decent beer selection as well. Plenty of windows, natural light, and views of the street.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom

CVgoN0rzkVgAt_KrlSjX5g.text: So when I most recently stayed in London, my mother and I walked by this restaurant twice a day for a week straight: once when we left our hotel to go to the Tube, once when we came back to the hotel. FINALLY, we made sure to walk by in time to actually enjoy a meal here.And oh my sweet goodness, what a meal it was. While the enormous menu offered an incredible variety of pancakes - from the standard kinds to more unique, savory kinds that I doubt you'd find elsewhere (Morracan lamb pancake, anyone?) - my mother and I were both in the mood for a sweet breakfast. And that's exactly what we got. I ended up devouring an entire plate of butterscotch pancakes with fresh, sweet bacon that went PERFECTLY with a side of fried eggs. My mother on the other hand ordered the sweet peach pancake - which was thin but crisp around the edges - and that came with cream which I actually loved on my own pancakes as much as I did on hers.I can say after seeing the size of our meals that this is definitely not the place to go for a small meal; in fact a party of people who came in after us ended up apologizing because they were staring at the enormous food-filled plates that were brought to us. Unfortunately I also remember that the service was not exceptionally quick; in fact my mother and I ended up wondering if the staff totally forgot about us a couple times, as we were seated in a different area of the restaurant than most of its other patrons that day.Overall though we left super satisfied, with full stomachs and very happy sweet-tooths. I would definitely go out of my way to return here for a meal during future treks to London.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Sweet peach pancake (basically a giant crepe).
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Butterscotch pancakes with fried eggs and bacon.

hP24yBLcbke7ZORKrDDs8w.text: I went on a Monday to get the £5.25 deal which was so worth it! I got the pancake with bacon, spinach, mozzarella, and cherry tomatoes (I can't remember if it had a specific name or not.). It was really delicious, especially with a drizzle of Tabasco. Only thing was that I felt that the pancake was quite greasy. But for £5.25, it's worthwhile and super filling! You'll be full for hours after

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Bacon, mozzarella, spinach, and cherry tomato

sIeSZ9ZreDgPWF2K-yeUvA.text: I love My Old Dutch!!!  My Old Dutch is such a great place to go to because of many reasons.  Such as, the pancakes are huge and it's a whole new experience.  However, I do not recommend eating there for your meal as the food is not very good EXCEPT for all the dessert stuff.  The dessert stuff is wonderful.  A must Do!!!

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. The Other Side of artwork at My Old Dutch
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. So of the artwork at My Old Dutch
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. The Nutella Pancake at My Old Dutch

TPXypNSDZZ83i7CkQzkQVQ.text: Fabulous service, pancakes and ambience. Go here for your brekkie as a filling treat!!

pb15mxkDkMuVPF6r26GzvQ.text: Come here hungry, you are guaranteed to leave feeling full! Incredible pancakes!! So I finally had the chance to taste these amazing pancakes (it was epic fail the first time as it was pancake day, the queue was a mile long outside and so we had no chance!). Their menu is incredible!!! They have so many options for both sweet and savoury (and in fact pretty impressive starters too). I was very excited to see Bitterballen on the menu as it reminded me of my travels in Europe (if you have never tried them I seriously recommend it - it's mince beef with a creamy sauce/mashed potato filling served with mustard...hmmmm Bitterballen). They also had a cheese version so you veggies out there don't miss out on the good stuff (so considerate) - I can safely say that those sticky, cheese-oozing balls are goooood!! After pondering the menu for quite some time (tough choices with all the options), my friend and I finally decided on our pancakes - Some Like it Hot for me (spicy chicken, chillies, onions and CHEESE) and smoked salmon for my friend (as the name suggests smoked salmon, but with a creamy, rich sauce with mushrooms). We were both delighted with our choices.  We did well finishing the massive pancake (served on the biggest plate I have ever seen -even bigger than a Romana pizza!) but despite really wanting to try a sweet pancake, there was simply no room. But...that gives us a excuse to go back (like we need one). I'm sure I'll be seeing My Old Dutch very soon...

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Ratatouille and spinach

8o8s3LNnQqBaBXtxxBg4lQ.text: I'd been recommended my old Dutch by lots of friends so really wanted to check it out. It didn't seem quite as extravagant as I had expected but there was a great atmosphere - almost like a US diner style. This together with the great service from the friendly waitresses helped the overall vibe. The menu is very diverse. Lots to choose from its almost too much. I went for the butterscotch pancakes with eggs and bacon. An interesting choice but I was pleased - tasted great :) They also have gluten free pancakes and waffles We also got the peppermint lattes. One of the nicest coffee drinks I remember tasting. Complete with whipped cream on top and not at all too sweet. My friend got the Hawaiian pancake. While my pancakes were the small thick type, hers was the thin long style. I think I prefer that type. It would be helpful if they could state on the menu which type of pancake you'd be getting. Overall I had a great experience and would recommend. Definitely a place you can try out more than once thanks to the huge range of pankakes available.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Peppermint latte!

4t4rrnEE_RmPgH-_9v6rEw.text: I first came here 20 years ago and have been back dozens of times since. The last time was a couple of years ago and it's really changed. The cosy bar area for beers and bitte/kaasboller is gone. The menu is bigger and more kid-friendly (? good or bad depending on your point of view). The fruit beers are still available -phew. The biggest change is in the pancakes. Granted it was Monday and all pancakes are £5, but the food was inedible. The pancake was no longer, thin, silky and crisp at the edges. It was like eating a flat, undercooked Yorkshire pudding. The bacon was fatty, it was drowned in cheese (not even melted) and was a thick bright yellow disc of rubber. The one star is for the peanut milkshake and our poor server who was upbeat and helpful despite everything. RIP My Old Dutch :0(

kNfzOk2cPs1fpzoZBmiEYA.text: I've been here several times recently, because the pancakes are tasty and good value.If you go on a Monday, the majority of the pancakes are £5. Be warned, one pancake is *definitely* enough! I've seen too many people think they want a savoury one, then a sweet one. Guys. You can't handle it. If anything, the pancakes can be a bit too much (the four cheese became a grim marathon), but I appreciate going somewhere in central London and getting two meals for a tenner!On Mondays I don't think you can book but I went with a group of 9 and they got us a table quickly as the downstairs is massive. When it isn't a Monday, prices are reasonable considering the size of the meal (about £7 to £11).The poffertjes are also definitely worth a shout if you aren't battered out!There are a few reasons it doesn't get a higher rating. Firstly, as a cheap eatery, it does feel a little bit rough around the edges (nothing like the beautiful pannekoeken huis I went to when I lived in The Netherlands). Service can be slow and gets things wrong. One time I asked for a pancake without spinach - when it came with the spinach, I sent it back, then when it came back, it was obviously the same pancake with the spinach taken off as the pancake itself had spinach integrated in the batter. I didn't bother returning it a second time but it was frustrating that it was wrong twice.The less said about the toilets, the faster the memories will be exorcised.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Traditional poffertjes

4b6p7iLe8-eA_BbQlVbk9Q.text: A classic to be honest. Want a nutella crepe but also want something savoury because you haven't had lunch yet? WHY NOT. Mind you, even though they're not REALLY pancakes and more like the thinner crepe cousin, they are still quite filling. In my opinion I always try to go with someone else so we share a savoury one first and then share a dessert crepe after! Their poffertjes are also A+. They do get VERY busy on Mondays when they have the pancake specials and deals, so expect to wait!!

PYE30serCbCyeGz-eRg2uw.text: huge portions. so many different combinations. only tried the savory kind but want to come back for the sweets!

ekyZUqPYOjo9DMxr0e_O5Q.text: Best pancakes ever!!!!! Its all about the banana and chocolate. The pancakes are huge, and the banana is cooked inside the pancake and then you get a lovely little pot of chocolate sauce in the middle. Oooohhh, just love this place!

4P9gjXF61mOQL_fPCO69NA.text: This pancake house has been around for years. Many a lunch time and evening meals were had at this wonderful place. Tasty pancakes of the most huge types delivered to you at the table in the largest plates ever. Always service with a smile when I used to go there in the 80's and 90's and I would want to eat there again, this millennium. Central to Holborn, Tottenham Court Road Stations, a stones throw from The Gt. British Museum and many office and shops, this place is going to be here for a long time. Parking is not available as is the case in most locations in central London but the public service route and journey on foot is very easy to do. There's loads to see along the way.

4if32aiGeG7vRsmsIw9vcw.text: I had passed these chain pancake houses a few times before finally biting the bullet and checking out if they could compete with the many crepe and pancake places dotted around London's boroughs and markets. Well, in short, they can't, the main reason being that the prices are ridiculous for what you get. It's true, your circle of egg, flour and water stuffed with spinach and identified white cheese will fill you up, but its difficult to countenance paying a tenner for the pleasure. Besides, when I eat pancakes, I like to have a stack of them, plus a massive selection of fillings. If you really must visit My Old Dutch, make sure you do it on a Monday, when all pancakes on the menu are £5.

RkDzigfvq_jChY8OrjYd-g.text: This is an old favourite from my childhood! The pancakes still seem nearly as big served on massive Dutch plates. Tey also have loads of cool plates hanging on the wall. The pancakes are very tasty; I usually order the spinach and cheese one because it makes a great combination. They are very filling though and best just to share a sweet pancake as your eyes are often bigger than your mouth!

qUre2ikeb1JeY8C3zPcQFA.text: I love pancakes and this is the place where you can get a huge varieties. Both savory and sweet. It is a good place to take gals for dates as most gals like pancakes. It is also inexpensive and casual. The casual atmosphere provide a better setting for having a night out which gals that you are trying to get to know more. The milkshakes is not that good though, I have tried once and it was pretty horrible. I didn't know about the £5 deals on Monday, maybe I should try next Monday is it is still available!

ngcSeLZXWXsMhuVg6yNeYA.text: You would really think that a pancake would fill you up but my word. There are loads of varieties and you can also choose your own ingredients. They are really filling but delicious. Especially the yummy deserts. They have a £5 deal on mondays on selected pancakes and this is a really good deal. It is normally fairly busy but it is world famous so what do you expect, though this does mean service can be really slow - i once waited an hour between courses. I strongly recommend going on an empty stomach!

jkfV5qIXQlU5pjtV-1_rbg.text: Sorry, I can't help myself! Pancakes(crepes) are my weak spot I'm afraid and this little den of inequity got me square between the eyes. It doesn't help that this place is located just around the corner from where I used to work and almost directly opposite the Princess Louise (see review). Suffice to say I nearly became a regular. What was I supposed to do? Luckily, the menu is extensive but pretty straight forward - you either order savoury or sweet but whatever it is be prepared to see it sitting on a pancake the size of a truck tire! If you go as a couple you can always share! The fruit beers are amazing too and highly recommended as an ideal accompaniment! The interior is bright ,breezy and spacious. The staff are exceptionally friendly and willing to assist you in any manner possible. The food is a delight and served quickly and efficiently. Prices are a little expensive but not by London standards. Be prepared to walk out a few pounds heavier! Don't wait for Shrove Tuesday (Pancake Day!). You'll be back! Enjoy!

Oa51A-cnPwujYqPxbTOBDQ.text: not coming here on Pancake day would be a sin, a crime, a crazy act!!! so thankfully i went and had a nutella,banana,nuts and ice cream pancake as big as the enormous plate it came on! bang bang!

lP0t84Q2G17DRz8v_cv0Kg.text: We visited My Old Dutch on Pancake Day - along with seemingly everyone else in London... We were prepared for the wait in the rain, with our umbrellas at the ready. But the seemingly huge queue went down very quickly (much to my partner's dismay as he wanted to watch the match in the pub across the road...!) The maitre d' was very helpful and quick to seat us downstairs. Our friendly waitress was at the table with our menus as soon as we were seated. We decided to go for a starter of fried cheese balls and a duck and greek pancake to share between three of us as a main course. The cheese balls came speedily to the table and were absolutely delicious! I can't fault them one bit. The main course of pancakes (of course) was beautiful too, especially the Greek. The halloumi cheese was delicious, and I when I asked for no olives, I got no olives.. fantastic! The only strange moment was with dessert. We had the Nutella pancake, which again was beautifully made. We asked for a scoop of ice cream with the pancake, and rather than a generic Vanilla ice-cream scoop, for some reason we had strawberry.. which was lovely for my partner and mother, but I myself am not a fan of strawberry ice cream. Apart from that, absolutely DELICIOUS! I'm looking forward to going back on a Monday to indulge in the £5 Monday deal.

o5-DOsbbORJLwvUdtx7pLQ.text: When I lived near King's Road I had always wanted to pop into this restaurant, and never did.  Years later I discovered one in Bloomsbury and was all excited because really, pancakes are delicious.  Also very hard to screw up.  So I knew we'd have some good eats here.  Correct was I!Only problem?  Portions are too large!  I can eat like a horse, and even I came no where close to finishing my meal.  I ordered a main and a dessert and was way too stuffed by the time the dessert came and barely touched it, which was a travesty because it was delicious!  So...my advice is, if you go for lunch, and there's a meal deal where you can get 2 courses at a set price, don't get two pancakes like I did.  Unbeknownst to me, the pancakes are HUGE.  Like, at least a foot and a half in diameter.  Lunch was a pancake with bacon and apples (The Amsterdammer.  So good.)  So then when my dessert came (pancake with chocolate sauce and chocolate ice cream) I didn't expect it to be the same massive size.  But it was.  With 3 giant scoops of ice cream.  And chocolate sauce.  And chocolate sprinkles.So - if you order like I did, make sure you've got a hungry friend with you!MInus one star for the loud children running around.  It's definitely a "family" place.  And certainly touristy.  And an exclusively East Asian staff sort of takes away from the olde country Dutch-y-ness of the whole thing and reminds you that you're indeed in a chain restaurant.But very very delicious.  Mmmmm pancakes.

EoGME_xwoAOwhv2Bp8WsRA.text: A great place to eat. The pancakes are enormous, and I definitely could only manage one course. One day I will go just for the sweet pancakes. I've not got past the main course yet! Mondays is a good day to go because all pancakes are just £5. On other days they are quite a bit more expensive. But Mondays is always very busy. Be prepared to wait at least 10 minutes before being served

WrerGfFpXYFJYiURJshmcA.text: So I was walking through London...lost. Really, I spent the whole trip, all 5 glorious days, getting lost. On purpose! I had never been to London before and had been seriously thinking about visiting for YEARS. Finally, I was sick of wishing and hoping, and decided that I would just go gosh darn it! So, with very little plans in terms of sightseeing, I just went to various neighborhoods armed with my well stocked Google Maps (full of delightful restaurants - food was the one thing I made time to plan) and perambulated about. As I was trying to orient myself in the area, I saw that My Old Dutch was nearby on GMaps, so I thought "heck! I am not leaving here without stuffing my face with sweet pancake-y goodness" and boy am I so glad I did! I ordered a sweet pancake, really a crepe - though sweeter and chewier, with powdered sugar and nutella. OMG, this thing was enormous and oh so good! I was really planning on having just a few bites as it really wasn't that long since I had had lunch, but I almost finished off the plate! It was sweet and chewy, good enough to eat alone but nutella just kicked the flavors into overdrive! Little piggy that I was, I knew I couldn't leave without finally trying poffertjes, tiny pancakes renowned throughout the Netherlands. I got mine to go and it's a shame I didn't snap a pic. They were thick and chewy, almost like little cupcakes, and filled with little morsels of chocolate. Absolute heaven. Next time, I'll have to make it to Amsterdam so I can do some comparison tasting, but My Old Dutch is definitely Good Eats.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom. Sweet Pancake with Nutella and Powdered Sugar

e5Rm9MRkl5BWwXOkhGP09g.text: Not nearly as good as Pancake Bakery in Amsterdam, but a decent creperie nonetheless.We came on Monday around lunchtime for the £5 pancake deal, so the place was packed. We were lucky enough to be seated immediately. My friend and I shared a duck and a berry. We had some issues with drinks (our waitress didn't seem to know what she was doing at all), and the food came later than we would've liked, but considering how busy the place was, the service was acceptable. The food was decent, but nothing to write home about. The pancakes were crepes, not actual pancakes, and unlike Pancake Bakery, the dishes consisted of way more crepe than filling. They looked big, but we finished them really quickly. The duck pancake was good, but there were only two or three small pieces of duck in it -- it just tasted like a hoisin sauce-flavoured crepe with a mushroom here and there. The berry pancake was kind of a let down. The berries were unbearably sour, even when mixed with a huge spoonful of ice cream. I'll definitely come back on another Monday to try more savoury flavours (the chicken curry and the chili con carne both sound really good) but I'll make sure to lower my expectations before I go.

uUWJrRCEmC7zGwqaDAwJYg.text: I always look forward to pancake days because it's an excuse to eat pancakes. Sometimes I find it difficult to walk past a crepe stall without indulging in the lemon and sugar variety.So ofcourse I jumped at the chance of going to My Old Dutch Pancake House in Holborn. Unfortunately I was not overly impressed with my pancake which tasted very doughy and lacked a lot of filling. I also think I may have chosen the wrong filling by trying to be adventerous!The bacon and cheese tasted quite rubbery and for almost £9 this was  the most expensive pancake I have ever bought!I think from now on I will just stick to my crepe suzette from the street stall.Tempted by the thought of

cJPHVMnh2ZDr756GKhPbNA.text: A lovely informal restaurant: I must have spent about 3 hours there in total: coffee with a friend then lunch with some more friends, and the staff didn't try to hurry us up at all. The pancake was (predictably) too big, and I couldn't finish it. But it was delicious; and so was the chocolate milkshake.

tpQKGUesQdb3KakxG0zX9Q.text: It took a bit of persuading from my boyfriend to first go here, but we did and we went again today. We might even go next Monday too as I am thinking of starting 'Monday Club' as on Mondays all pancakes at My Old Dutch are only £5! I haven't had a sweet pancake yet, the savoury ones are served on massive plates as sort of open crepes with toppings. Like a pancake pizza. They are very, very filling. The service has been excellent each time we have been, very smiley and friendly and efficient to boot. It hasn't been busy - maybe because we've been there before 8pm each time - and has a very informal and relaxed atmosphere. The drinks are quite expensive but are brilliant. The smoothies taste like the fruit fell straight off the tree and into your glass via a blender. The milkshakes are massive. I would give it five stars, as the location, service and food is great, but the prices on any day of the week except Monday make it a bit too expensive for what is (ingredients wise) a cheap meal.

D2FkjkenEe-9cVlgwkAg_A.text: This pancake place is great! It has a really lovely friendly atmosphere; perfect for a date and a fun dinner option with friends and family. Be warned, the pancakes are huge! I had the artichoke pancake and a tasty fruit beer. The service wasn't amazing as they forgot we had ordered a sweet pancake and then took forever to bring us the bill, but we were sooo stuffed we didn't really mind.

ljJpvzZgEvQJcwV9gAB9Dg.text: I love pancakes but My Old Dutch left a lot to be desired. I had the pancake with the summer berries and that was just so-so (the sauce itself was a bit sour). The waffles were slightly better but only just. The strawberry milkshake was horrid and tasted like it had been made using strawberry nesquick - not what you expect when you're paying about £3 for it. I have been tempted to go back to try their savoury pancakes as they did look ok, but then again with so many other places to eat, I think I'll stick to eating elsewhere.

gUAYLkRad-l3zO1noQgUCQ.text: The Atmosphere was full of groups of people young and old from every culture the vibe of is homely and old-fashioned, a bit like sitting in someone's dinning room or a friendly Dutch landlords public house. A relaxed holiday feeling as everything is at a unrushed, unhurried pace and there is a air of novelty and sense of almost being transported back in time to a very special place in Holland. The Food The Menu is fun and helps customers easily chose from sweet or savory pancakes to delight and tantalize the test buds. The Savory, Lamb Stew, Chicken Curry and The Make Ya Own. The savory pancakes are a little more like pizza with so many toppings to chose from and all are pleasing to the eye as well as the pallet. The most popular dish on the list is The Amsterdamer. Soft yellow pancake that just melt in the moth oozing with gorges juicy apple slices and thick slices of Dutch beacon all c coved in a sticky, gooey real maple syrup making this a cross between breakfast and desert and so large on arrival its pleasing to the eye and satisfying to each tasty morsel in each mouthful and very hard even when full to leave any on the plate. At around £7.00 - £11.00 each pancake its worth making a meal out of it, filling and wholesome, this is real food as well a good fast food as it takes less than 15 minuets to be served and less then 10 to fill you boots.

photos.caption: Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom
Photo of My Old Dutch - London, United Kingdom

7gq3AhOFtY85p83No9MG_A.text: As the name suggests, this place specializes in pancakes. That by the way means the european pancakes, not the american style thick ones. They serve both savoury (e.g. bacon and cheese) and sweet (e.g. vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce) pancakes. The pancakes are very thin but really large and served on a oversized plate. The starters are also highly recommendable, especially the "kaasballen" (fried cheese balls). The place tends to be busy, but there is a small bar and a corner with a couch to sit while waiting for a table. Service was friendly and fast. The menu is available online on their website.

MG_DEqtUEX6dznvHHkmdpA.text: Even though I didn't expect American style fluffy pancakes, I also hadn't expected the excessively thin pancakes that My Old Dutch served that seemed more like crepes than anything else. The size of them certainly look impressive with the pancake fitting an excessively large plate, and the table barely able to fit two of them there with drinks and cutlery included. I had a savoury one that went down surprisingly well and had plenty of toppings to keep me satisfied. I know that they have a £5 deal on Monday evenings though the line is always out the door to make it worth my while waiting what seems like quite long. I can't believe they have dessert pancakes as well considering that you're pretty full by the time you finish one that I just wasn't in the mood for consuming pretty much the same thing but just adorned with sweeter toppings.

HmI59rcI8H4YFilEmHOqLg.text: wow this place is nuts! i went there with a friend for lunch today, I had the berry medley pancake and he had the pear and cinnamon pancake....what I received I was NOT expecting! The pancake is in thick crepe style and is about the same diameter as a car tyre!! Giant! and topped off with 3 scoops of ice cream! It was a lot of food and I could not finish it, but it was very tasty!They also do savoury pancakes which I would like to try!Well worth checking out if you have a craving for a batter and sugar combo.The smoothies are nice too! Oh and its very good value!

1bmWCdz2iTNP5eIZsTVKfw.text: Sister to the Kings Road, London branch, this is always a very busy restaurant whatever time of day you pop in to eat. If you want to go in as a larger group at lunch or in the evening, do try to book ahead. The pancakes here do the job and fill you up, 'tho to my disappointment the menu does change quite regularly and usually that means my favourite dish is knocked off the list. The pancakes are not thick and goeey, but rather thin and dollops of topping (chicken curry topping sounds revolting but is actually quite nice). They arrive on the most enormous blue & white Dutch patterned plates. The dessert pancakes are of a smaller quantity but I've never yet managed both a main course and dessert pancake in the same sitting. Service is usually better in the evenings than at lunchtime, we've found. Prices are reasonable - with a beer (fruit and normal beers readily available, as are soft drinks and the usual other drinks made available in restaurants) you are looking at around £12 for a main course, drink and service charge.

K320p3a5jsYVJqKK9ujNsg.text: My Old Dutch serves very large crepe type pancakes on these enormous, although often chipped, plates. This particular restaurant can get very busy, although I have managed to visit and be served on a week day within an hour during my lunch break. This is definitely one where looks can be deceptive as I never thought I would be full up after consuming one of these pancakes, especially as there are both savoury and sweet varieties on the menu. All I can say is that I have never managed to have a sweet one!! The atmosphere is very relaxed and informal, it is definitely a jeans and t-shirt type venue, and the prices are very reasonable.

_2czN3cy3ewszElRQre4ig.text: My Old Dutch is a bit of a dissapointment. Don't come here looking for your typical Americana style Pancakes which are usually big and fluffy. Instead these are served in more of a 'dutch' style which similate more to French crepes. My entrees weren't very good and the pancakes were a let down. The service and location is good. Only if you really need to eat!

0OKYrChtwTUAJ3kY2gVc_w.text: Celebrated my first Pancake Day here! It was very crowded but we were seated quickly. I had the Mediterrean pancake. It was yummy. I was expecting a pancake but it essentially was a crepe with sundried tomatoes, cheese and olives-all yummy just the same. Next time I plan to eat sweet.

bFnKcDc25n5QI0_DWZf7jA.text: I went here with a friend who had not been before and he was amazed at the choice and huge size of the pancakes. Nice atmosphere to sit and chat without it being too noisy and crammed. Friendly and polite staff. Pancake was served up quickly and I have to say I had a mint chocolate milkshake and it was the best iv ever had. I didnt think it was over priced for what we had. I managed to eat my main meal though my friend couldnt due to the sheer size and quantity of filling of his pancake. couldnt manage a starter or pudding!!!! Definantly recommend eating here if youv never experienced it. My friend has now recommended it to all his friends and collegues.
